problem.p: A line goes through points \( \vec{a}, \vec{b} \in \mathbb{R}^3 \). Give an expression for the minimum distance from this line to a third point \( \vec{c} \).

ul.li: You may enter \(\vec{a}\), \(\vec{b}\), and \(\vec{c}\) as veca, vecb, and vecc.

problem.p: This demo problem is primarily intended to show off the cross product. Some suggested inputs:

ul.li: cross(1, [1, 2, 3]) to see hepful error messages. All standard functions (norm, trans, det, ...) provided by the MatrixGrader class give similar error messages when something goes wrong.
